column5: Not "spinnerbaits", but the kind pictured    They seem to be a bit hard to find these days, although I can find some on-line. Quite a versatile little rig, IMO.  I have various in-line bait spinners, but  I prefer the kind pictured in some cases.  thx for your help.
They sell em at canadian tire here but theyre called beetle spinners
Mr Twister was the original I think.  At canadian tire look for either red wolf or danielson.  Michael

Mr Twister was the original I think.  At canadian tire look for either red wolf or danielson.  Michael  I have seen the red wolf brand at CTC Harold. Walmart has them as well. Southbend might be the brand.
Ding ding ding! ^  Can you believe I couldn't remember southbend to save my life while I was typing that!  That is what Walmart carries Brian.  Michael
http://www.yakimabait.com/products/jig-spinner/  Hildebrandt was the brand I usually saw here.
In the 70's the original split tail Beetle Spins were made by Johnson.
Thx guys. I guess they are not as scarce as I thought. I had checked C. Tire here in Wasagaa and on Bayfield as well as Wally's here in Wasaga.
I keep some smaller ones in my panfish box  Turns all my jigs into spinnerbaits if I so choose
Strike King and Mr.Crappy have brought them back under their name "SPIN BABY"
Turns all my jogs into spinnerbaits if I do choose  egg-zakly!
Johnson is still making beetle spins. BPS has a big selection of them
